content.description:
Start on the jug in the middle of the ultimate boulder.  Go up right to a triangle rock pinch.  Bring your left hand up to a crimp and you can either dyno to the nice shelf or move left to a slope then up to the shelf.  Top out for the finish. 

  Problem 3 on the ultimate boulder problem area picture.
content.protection: One or two crash pads should be enough.

content.description:
Start on the right side of the ultimate boulder and traverse along the crimps and jug in the middle over to the left side.  Work your way into Left Line and continue up the jugs to the top.  Top out for the finish.  

  Problem 5 on the ultimate boulder area picture.
content.protection: A couple crash pads and spotter for the bad landing of Left line.

content.description:
This starts on the main jug in the middle of the boulder and works its way up left along the arete.  Work your way along all the jugs up to the top and top out. 

  Problem 2 on the ultimate boulder area picture.
content.protection: A crash bad and spotter - pretty bad landing so don't fall!

content.description:
Sit start near the pointy rock and work up some crimps to the the top.  Top out for the finish. 

  Problem 4 on the ultimate boulder area picture.
content.protection: A couple crash pads and spotter to avoid landing on the rock!

content.description:
Start on the left arete on the Africa looking flake.  Work your way up on some crimps and instead of going back left on the course of Left Line, keep working your way straight up.  This line is on a bunch of crimps just left of the ultimate boulder problem.  Top out for the finish. 

  Problem 1 Variation on ultimate boulder area picture.
content.protection: One crash pad and a good spotter

content.description:
Start on the Arete and Africa looking flake.  Go up right on crimps and slopers half way up then work way back towards the arete and into the last couple holds of Left Line. Top out at the top of left line for the finish. 

  Problem 1 on ultimate boulder area picture.
content.protection: A couple crash pads and a good spotter - bad landing!

content.description: This is a great boulder with a South facing side.  It has a couple more technical and crimpy problems on it that are still fairly easy to do.  Definitely a must in this area.
